DOC.brief_summary: evaluate the impact of different anthropometric measures on clinical and endoscopic severity of GERD and its relation to serum leptin.
DOC.brief_title: Anthropometric Measures and Severity of Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease
DOC.criteria: Gastro esophageal reflux symptoms (e.g. heart burn, regurgitation, water brash or atypical symptoms such as hoarseness of voice, asthma and cough) complete upper gastrointestinal endoscopy. Receiving medication for reflux disease (including proton pump inhibitor, histamine type 2 receptors blocker, prokinetic agents) in the previous month. Pregnant woman. History of upper abdominal surgery. Severe comorbidity as cirrhosis, endstage renal disease and heart failure.
DOC.keyword: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease; Anthropometric Measures; Leptin
